Title: Access to open resources from TRE
Description: Most of the genomic analyses require some kind of data on the outside world, be it a reference genome or annotation databases. In some cases these can be downloaded pre-analysis to the TRE, but this tends to hinder analysis workflows that, from the POV of the users, work on the outside of a TRE. Examples: annotation of genomes, reference sequences for sequence alignment, usage of ontologies and other open resources.

Evidence.Evidence Artifact Example: SOP describing how data provider can allow software in the TRE
Policy defining how to request pre-allocation of project-specific data resources
Metadata entries in the (internal) TRE indexing system for reference genomes / ontologies datasets
